decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy creatures with low mana cost and aggressive abilities to overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to both the opponent and their creatures, while also maintaining card advantage through spells like Academic Dispute and Stock Up. The mana base is designed to allow for consistent access to both red and blue spells, while also providing flexibility in terms of land types. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games swiftly.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying small creatures and using Collected Company to generate value and pressure opponents. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Ouroboroid to disrupt opponents while maintaining a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Voice of Resurgence and Knight of Autumn adds versatility and resilience to the deck, allowing it to adapt to various matchups. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive game plan, ensuring consistent access to the deck's key threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II combo to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes a combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and hand disruption like Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces until they can be assembled. By controlling the board with creatures like Guardian of New Benalia and Seasoned Hallowblade, the deck aims to set up a dominating position and secure the win. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the combo and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with evasive and disruptive creatures. By playing multiple low-cost creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer and Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to establish a board presence early on and control the game with counter spells like Spell Queller. Skyclave Apparition and Shacklegeist provide additional removal options to deal with opposing threats. Enduring Curiosity and No More Lies help to maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of threats. The deck's synergy and aggressive strategy make it a formidable force in the Pioneer format.

The deck focuses on playing cheap and efficient creatures to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent. Cards like Thraben Inspector and Novice Inspector provide card advantage while Venerated Loxodon and Warden of the Inner Sky help buff the team. With a mix of white and red mana sources, the deck can easily cast its spells and utilize powerful cards like Cosmogrand Zenith and Gleeful Demolition to control the board and push for lethal damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on playing fast and aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using efficient spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the path, cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage can deal significant damage early on. The deck also includes Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monstrous Rage for additional reach and power. The key strategy is to maintain pressure and close out the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The key focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining cards that disrupt the opponent's game plan such as Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with powerful threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage rapidly. Utilizing land cards like Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway, along with versatile spells like Duress and Abrade, the deck seeks to maintain momentum and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced match.

The main idea of the Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with efficient creatures like Bishop of Wings, Righteous Valkyrie, and Resplendent Angel while using cards like Collected Company to generate card advantage. The deck also aims to gain life through cards like Giada, Font of Hope and Kayla's Reconstruction to trigger abilities and stay ahead in the aggro mirror matches. The mana base consists of quick lands like Brushland and Razorverge Thicket to ensure a smooth curve while incorporating some removal in the form of Skyclave Apparition.

The deck focuses on generating value and card advantage through casting cheap cantrips, utilizing Mox artifacts for ramp, and controlling the board with disruptive spells like Spell Pierce. The key strategy involves assembling the Retraction Helix combo with creatures like Rona, Herald of Invasion and Valley Floodcaller to repeatedly bounce opponent's permanents, while also utilizing Otawara, Soaring City for additional value. This allows for a tempo-based game plan that aims to outmaneuver and outpace the opponent while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive playstyle by utilizing green devotion cards. By focusing on generating large amounts of green mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Llanowar Elves, the deck can quickly ramp up to play powerful creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll. Additionally, cards like Storm the Festival and Outcaster Trailblazer help to maintain card advantage and board presence, while also enabling quick and efficient creature plays. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and fast mana generation.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence and aggressively attacking the opponent. It includes equipment cards like Colossus Hammer and Shadowspear to enhance the damage output of its creatures, as well as cards like Sigarda's Aid to play equipment at instant speed. The deck also features creatures with abilities that help with equipment, such as Kemba, Kha Enduring and Kazuul's Toll Collector. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and powerful equipment.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence by ramping up mana with green creatures and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, while using cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival to draw cards and find key pieces like Cavalier of Thorns and Elder Gargaroth. The main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive green creatures like Old-Growth Troll and Outcaster Trailblazer, supported by powerful finishers like Lair of the Hydra. The deck's synergy and devotion to green mana allow for explosive starts and overwhelming board states.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Novice Inspector to apply pressure to the opponent. Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition provide removal options, while cards like Venerated Loxodon and Cosmogrand Zenith help buff the team and push for more damage. The inclusion of cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Warden of the Inner Sky allow for explosive attacks, while key lands like Shefet Dunes and Sacred Foundry ensure the deck's mana base is consistent. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Questing Druid, Emberheart Challenger, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan while using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to clear the way. It also aims to maximize damage output with cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Reckless Rage. The deck utilizes a mixture of creatures, burn spells, and lands to maintain a fast-paced, aggressive strategy that can overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with green devotion creatures and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, allowing for explosive plays with big threats like Old-Growth Troll and Cavalier of Thorns. Storm the Festival is used to search for key creatures, while Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner provides card draw and untap abilities. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and powerful late-game threats, utilizing a mix of creatures with powerful abilities and efficient mana acceleration to dominate the board.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through counter spells, card draw, and removal while using Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion for additional value. The deck includes a mix of board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Settle the Wreckage, counterspells such as Dovin's Veto, and card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent by disrupting their game plan and maintaining card advantage until victory is achieved.
